Definition at line 2322 of file mgd.c.

References gdImageStruct::blue, gdImageColorAllocate(), gdImageColorClosest(), gdImageColorExact(), gdImageGetPixel(), gdImageGetTransparent, gdImageSetPixel(), gdMaxColors, gdImageStruct::green, and gdImageStruct::red.

02324 {
02325    int c;
02326    int x, y;
02327    int tox, toy;
02328    int i;
02329    int colorMap[gdMaxColors];
02330    for (i = 0; (i < gdMaxColors); i++) {
02331       colorMap[i] = (-1);
02332    }
02333    toy = dstY;
02334    for (y = srcY; (y < (srcY + h)); y++) {
02335       tox = dstX;
02336       for (x = srcX; (x < (srcX + w)); x++) {
02337          int nc;
02338          c = gdImageGetPixel(src, x, y);
02339          /* Added 7/24/95: support transparent copies */
02340          if (gdImageGetTransparent(src) == c) {
02341             tox++;
02342             continue;
02343          }
02344          /* Have we established a mapping for this color? */
02345          if (colorMap[c] == (-1)) {
02346             /* If it's the same image, mapping is trivial */
02347             if (dst == src) {
02348                nc = c;
02349             } else {
02350                /* First look for an exact match */
02351                nc = gdImageColorExact(dst, src->red[c], src->green[c], src->blue[c]);
02352             }
02353             if (nc == (-1)) {
02354                /* No, so try to allocate it */
02355                nc = gdImageColorAllocate(dst, src->red[c], src->green[c], src->blue[c]);
02356                /* If we're out of colors, go for the
02357                   closest color */
02358                if (nc == (-1)) {
02359                   nc = gdImageColorClosest(dst, src->red[c], src->green[c], src->blue[c]);
02360                }
02361             }
02362             colorMap[c] = nc;
02363          }
02364          gdImageSetPixel(dst, tox, toy, colorMap[c]);
02365          tox++;
02366       }
02367       toy++;
02368    }
02369 }

02373 {
02374    int c;
02375    int x, y;
02376    int tox, toy;
02377    int ydest;
02378    int i;
02379    int colorMap[gdMaxColors];
02380    /* Stretch vectors */
02381    int *stx;
02382    int *sty;
02383    /* We only need to use floating point to determine the correct
02384       stretch vector for one line's worth. */
02385    double accum;
02386    stx = (int *) M_MALLOC(sizeof(int) * srcW);
02387    sty = (int *) M_MALLOC(sizeof(int) * srcH);
02388    accum = 0;
02389    for (i = 0; (i < srcW); i++) {
02390       int got;
02391       accum += (double) dstW / (double) srcW;
02392       got = (int) floor(accum);
02393       stx[i] = got;
02394       accum -= got;
02395    }
02396    accum = 0;
02397    for (i = 0; (i < srcH); i++) {
02398       int got;
02399       accum += (double) dstH / (double) srcH;
02400       got = (int) floor(accum);
02401       sty[i] = got;
02402       accum -= got;
02403    }
02404    for (i = 0; (i < gdMaxColors); i++) {
02405       colorMap[i] = (-1);
02406    }
02407    toy = dstY;
02408    for (y = srcY; (y < (srcY + srcH)); y++) {
02409       for (ydest = 0; (ydest < sty[y - srcY]); ydest++) {
02410          tox = dstX;
02411          for (x = srcX; (x < (srcX + srcW)); x++) {
02412             int nc;
02413             if (!stx[x - srcX]) {
02414                continue;
02415             }
02416             c = gdImageGetPixel(src, x, y);
02417             /* Added 7/24/95: support transparent copies */
02418             if (gdImageGetTransparent(src) == c) {
02419                tox += stx[x - srcX];
02420                continue;
02421             }
02422             /* Have we established a mapping for this color? */
02423             if (colorMap[c] == (-1)) {
02424                /* If it's the same image, mapping is trivial */
02425                if (dst == src) {
02426                   nc = c;
02427                } else {
02428                   /* First look for an exact match */
02429                   nc = gdImageColorExact(dst, src->red[c], src->green[c], src->blue[c]);
02430                }
02431                if (nc == (-1)) {
02432                   /* No, so try to allocate it */
02433                   nc = gdImageColorAllocate(dst,
02434                                             src->red[c], src->green[c], src->blue[c]);
02435                   /* If we're out of colors, go for the
02436                      closest color */
02437                   if (nc == (-1)) {
02438                      nc = gdImageColorClosest(dst,
02439                                               src->red[c], src->green[c], src->blue[c]);
02440                   }
02441                }
02442                colorMap[c] = nc;
02443             }
02444             for (i = 0; (i < stx[x - srcX]); i++) {
02445                gdImageSetPixel(dst, tox, toy, colorMap[c]);
02446                tox++;
02447             }
02448          }
02449          toy++;
02450       }
02451    }
02452    M_FREE(stx);
02453    M_FREE(sty);
02454 }

01915       return 0;

01918       return 0;

01921    version[3] = '\0';
01922

01924       return 0;

01926    if (!ReadOK(fd, buf, 7)) {
01927       return 0;
01928    }
01929    BitPixel = 2 << (buf[4] & 0x07);
01930    ColorResolution = (int) (((buf[4] & 0x70) >> 3) + 1);
01931    Background = buf[5];
01932    AspectRatio = buf[6];
01933 
01934    if (BitSet(buf[4], LOCALCOLORMAP)) { /* Global Colormap */
01935       if (ReadColorMap(fd, BitPixel, ColorMap)) {
01936          return 0;
01937       }
01938    }
01939    for (;;) {
01940       if (!ReadOK(fd, &c, 1)) {
01941          return 0;
01942       }
01943       if (c == ';') {           /* GIF terminator */
01944          int i;
01945          if (imageCount < imageNumber) {
01946             return 0;
01947          }
01948          /* Terminator before any image was declared! */
01949          if (!im) {
01950             return 0;
01951          }
01952          /* Check for open colors at the end, so
01953             we can reduce colorsTotal and ultimately
01954             BitsPerPixel */
01955          for (i = ((im->colorsTotal - 1)); (i >= 0); i--) {
01956             if (im->open[i]) {
01957                im->colorsTotal--;
01958             } else {
01959                break;
01960             }
01961          }
01962          return im;
01963       }
01964 
01965       if (c == '!') {           /* Extension */
01966          if (!ReadOK(fd, &c, 1)) {
01967             return 0;
01968          }
01969          DoExtension(fd, c, &Transparent);
01970          continue;
01971       }
01972 
01973       if (c != ',') {           /* Not a valid start character */
01974          continue;
01975       }
01976 
01977       ++imageCount;
01978 
01979       if (!ReadOK(fd, buf, 9)) {
01980          return 0;
01981       }
01982 
01983       useGlobalColormap = !BitSet(buf[8], LOCALCOLORMAP);
01984 
01985       bitPixel = 1 << ((buf[8] & 0x07) + 1);
01986 
01987       imw = LM_to_uint(buf[4], buf[5]);
01988       imh = LM_to_uint(buf[6], buf[7]);
01989       if (!(im = gdImageCreate(imw, imh))) {
01990          return 0;
01991       }
01992       im->interlace = BitSet(buf[8], INTERLACE);
01993       if (!useGlobalColormap) {
01994          if (ReadColorMap(fd, bitPixel, localColorMap)) {
01995             return 0;
01996          }
01997          ReadImage(im, fd, imw, imh, localColorMap,
01998                    BitSet(buf[8], INTERLACE), imageCount != imageNumber);
01999       } else {
02000          ReadImage(im, fd, imw, imh,
02001                    ColorMap, BitSet(buf[8], INTERLACE), imageCount != imageNumber);
02002       }
02003       if (Transparent != (-1)) {
02004          gdImageColorTransparent(im, Transparent);
02005       }
02006    }
02007 }
